quotes.quote: No one can be saved in virtue of what he can do. Everyone can be saved in virtue of what God can do.
Salvation is not a reward for the righteous, it is a gift for the guilty.
Every year, if not every day, we have to wager our salvation upon some prophecy based upon imperfect knowledge.
Salvation is a work of God to show His glory. That's why He's not going to let it fail.
Saving us is the greatest and most concrete demonstration of God's love, the definitive display of His grace throughout time and eternity.
Salvation cannot come without revelation. Men of the present time testify of heaven and hell, and have never seen either; and I will say that no man knows these things without this.
The salvation of mankind lies only in making everything the concern of all.
The salvation of this human world lies nowhere else than in the human heart, in the human power to reflect, in human meekness and human responsibility.
Through salvation our past has been forgiven, our present is given meaning, and out future is secured.
Salvation has absolutely nothing to do with human merit and absolutely everything to do with divine mercy.
None of us can ever save himself; we are the instruments of one another's salvation, and only by the hope that we give to others do we lift ourselves out of the darkness into light.

Salvation is from our side a choice, from the divine side it is a seizing upon, an apprehending, a conquest by the Most High God. Our accepting and willing are reactions rather than actions. The right of determination must always remain with God.
Saving faith and real converting grace will always produce some conformity to the image of Jesus.
Salvation was universally considered to be much more becoming in women than in men.
Salvation cannot be bought with the currency of obedience; it is purchased by the blood of the Son of God.
The first step in a person's salvation is knowledge of their sin.
The salvation of the world lies in the human heart.
Our salvation is in work, but let us also take delight in that work.
Our salvation is in striving to achieve what we know we'll never achieve.
Human salvation lies in the hands of the creatively maladjusted.
Christ has accomplished your salvation. But He has not yet perfected your circumstances. Do not be confused in the two.
The savior who wants to turn men into angels is as much a hater of human nature as the totalitarian despot who wants to turn them into puppets.
Salvation is free, but discipleship costs everything we have.
The salvation of a single soul is more important than the production or preservation of all the epics and tragedies in the world.
There is no salvation in becoming adapted to a world which is crazy.
Work out your own salvation. Do not depend on others.
As long as Christ sits on the mediatorial throne every day is a good day and all days are days of salvation.
Forgiveness is the remission of sins. For it is by this that what has been lost, and was found, is saved from being lost again.
Salvation is the entire universe being brought back into harmony with its maker.
Not that our salvation should be the effect of our work, but our work should be the evidence of our salvation.
